meta.notes: Meanings are short, static interpretation aids (not predictive). Keywords are compact anchors; use context and position meanings from spreads.

cards.name: The Fool
cards.meaning: New beginnings and open-hearted curiosity. Trusting the path enough to take the first step and learn as you go.
cards.meaning_reversed: A leap without looking, or fear that blocks a fresh start. Missed cues, sloppy risks, or refusal to begin.

cards.name: The Magician
cards.meaning: Turning intention into action. Using tools, talent, and focus to shape outcomes through clear choices.
cards.meaning_reversed: Power used poorly or performatively. Talent without follow-through, or influence that veers into control.

cards.name: The High Priestess
cards.meaning: Quiet insight and deep perception. The truth is felt more than explained; listen inward and observe.
cards.meaning_reversed: Ignoring your own signals or drowning them out. Information withheld, misread, or kept for the wrong reasons.

cards.name: The Empress
cards.meaning: Growth through care and presence. Creating, sustaining, and enjoying the life you’re building.
cards.meaning_reversed: Care out of balance: depletion, smothering, or neglect. Creativity and warmth get stuck or withheld.

cards.name: The Emperor
cards.meaning: Order, responsibility, and clear boundaries. Building something durable through discipline and leadership.
cards.meaning_reversed: Control for its own sake, or structure collapsing from avoidance. A clash over authority and rules.

cards.name: The Hierophant
cards.meaning: Guidance through shared values, mentors, and proven frameworks. Learning from a lineage or system.
cards.meaning_reversed: Questioning the rules or rejecting a system that doesn’t fit. Tradition becomes limiting or performative.

cards.name: The Lovers
cards.meaning: A meaningful bond or a defining choice. Alignment of values, desire, and action.
cards.meaning_reversed: A split between values and behavior. Mixed signals, uneven commitment, or choices made from fear.

cards.name: The Chariot
cards.meaning: Momentum through focus and self-control. Picking a direction and pushing forward with commitment.
cards.meaning_reversed: Motion without direction, or control slipping. Force replaces strategy; progress stalls or turns chaotic.

cards.name: Strength
cards.meaning: Steady courage and gentle mastery. Handling intensity with calm, integrity, and heart.
cards.meaning_reversed: Confidence wavers or emotions run the show. Power feels forced, or energy drains from over-effort.

cards.name: The Hermit
cards.meaning: A pause for insight. Stepping back to clarify what’s true, essential, and worth pursuing.
cards.meaning_reversed: Retreat turns into hiding, or reflection becomes stuckness. Cutting off support or dodging reality.

cards.name: Wheel of Fortune
cards.meaning: A shift in circumstances. Cycles turn; timing matters, and flexibility helps you ride the change.
cards.meaning_reversed: Fighting the cycle or repeating the same lesson. Delays, setbacks, or patterns that won’t break yet.

cards.name: Justice
cards.meaning: Clear-eyed honesty and consequences. Decisions based on facts, ethics, and proportional response.
cards.meaning_reversed: Skewed judgment or dodged accountability. Truth gets bent, or fairness is missing from the equation.

cards.name: The Hanged Man
cards.meaning: A deliberate pause that changes how you see things. Letting go of control to gain insight.
cards.meaning_reversed: Stagnation without learning. Sacrifice that breeds resentment, or refusal to see another angle.

cards.name: Death
cards.meaning: An ending that clears space for renewal. Letting go of what’s done so the next chapter can begin.
cards.meaning_reversed: Holding on past the expiration date. Change is delayed, messy, or resisted despite obvious closure.

cards.name: Temperance
cards.meaning: Blending opposites into something workable. Steady progress through moderation and thoughtful pacing.
cards.meaning_reversed: Too much, too fast, or not enough care. Parts don’t integrate; tension rises and harmony slips.

cards.name: The Devil
cards.meaning: Bondage to desire, fear, or habits. Seeing where you’re hooked—and what it costs.
cards.meaning_reversed: A chance to loosen the chains. Awareness grows; you step out of a trap or renegotiate a dynamic.

cards.name: The Tower
cards.meaning: A sudden shake-up that exposes what’s unstable. Painful clarity that forces an honest rebuild.
cards.meaning_reversed: Trying to avoid the inevitable, or a breakdown happening in slow motion. Truth leaks out over time.

cards.name: The Star
cards.meaning: A return of faith and calm after turbulence. Healing, clarity, and a gentle sense of direction.
cards.meaning_reversed: Hope feels far or fragile. Cynicism, exhaustion, or disconnection from what inspires you.

cards.name: The Moon
cards.meaning: Foggy terrain and emotional undercurrents. Trust intuition, but verify—things aren’t fully revealed yet.
cards.meaning_reversed: The haze lifts. Confusion decreases, deception is spotted, and intuition becomes easier to read.

cards.name: The Sun
cards.meaning: Warmth, confidence, and visible progress. Things become simpler, brighter, and more life-giving.
cards.meaning_reversed: Joy is blocked or overstated. Confidence wobbles, or success is delayed by pride or burnout.

cards.name: Judgement
cards.meaning: A moment of truth and a chance to choose again. Closure, accountability, and stepping into a clearer path.
cards.meaning_reversed: Refusing the wake-up call. Harsh self-judgment or avoidance keeps you repeating yesterday.

cards.name: The World
cards.meaning: A cycle completes. Integration, mastery, and the satisfaction of finishing what you started.
cards.meaning_reversed: Almost there, but something needs closure. A final step, a missing piece, or fear of finishing.

cards.name: Ace of Wands
cards.meaning: A fresh surge of energy and desire to begin. A bold idea asking for action and experimentation.
cards.meaning_reversed: The spark flickers. Doubt, delay, or scattered effort prevents the idea from catching fire.

cards.name: Two of Wands
cards.meaning: Looking beyond the current horizon. Making a plan, weighing options, and choosing a direction to grow.
cards.meaning_reversed: Vision without movement, or movement without vision. Fear narrows the world; plans stall.

cards.name: Three of Wands
cards.meaning: Early results and growing momentum. You’ve set things in motion—now track what’s coming back.
cards.meaning_reversed: Plans hit friction. Timing is off or support is thin; adjust strategy rather than forcing it.

cards.name: Four of Wands
cards.meaning: A pause to celebrate and ground the win. Community, belonging, and a stable base to build from.
cards.meaning_reversed: Celebration feels forced, or stability is shaky. Domestic friction, misalignment, or a missing sense of belonging.

cards.name: Five of Wands
cards.meaning: Clashing energy and competing agendas. Useful conflict can sharpen skills if it stays fair and focused.
cards.meaning_reversed: Drama without purpose, or conflict pushed underground. The real issue needs naming and structure.

cards.name: Six of Wands
cards.meaning: A visible win and earned recognition. Momentum increases when you accept support and show up proudly.
cards.meaning_reversed: Success feels shaky or unshared. Attention, validation, or teamwork is missing—or ego gets in the way.

cards.name: Seven of Wands
cards.meaning: Holding your ground. Defend what matters with clarity and backbone—especially under pressure.
cards.meaning_reversed: Too many battles at once. Boundaries slip; energy drains. Choose what’s worth defending.

cards.name: Eight of Wands
cards.meaning: Fast movement and clear momentum. Things line up; communication flows; events accelerate.
cards.meaning_reversed: Static, crossed wires, or frantic speed without coordination. Slow down enough to aim.

cards.name: Nine of Wands
cards.meaning: Staying steady after setbacks. Protect your energy, learn from experience, and keep going wisely.
cards.meaning_reversed: Guard up too high, or energy too low. Past wounds run the present; rest and recalibrate.

cards.name: Ten of Wands
cards.meaning: Carrying too much alone. Success comes with weight; prioritize, delegate, and set limits.
cards.meaning_reversed: Putting the burden down. Asking for help, simplifying, and choosing what’s actually yours to carry.

cards.name: Page of Wands
cards.meaning: A playful new spark—learning, experimenting, and saying yes to possibility.
cards.meaning_reversed: Enthusiasm without substance, or fear of looking foolish. Energy scatters; the message is unclear.

cards.name: Knight of Wands
cards.meaning: A confident push forward. Taking risks, acting fast, and chasing what excites you.
cards.meaning_reversed: Fast starts and faster exits. Impulses overrule commitments; intensity becomes unstable.

cards.name: Queen of Wands
cards.meaning: Radiant self-belief and creative command. You lead by example, with generosity and fire.
cards.meaning_reversed: Confidence turns brittle. Comparison, possessiveness, or over-control dims the warmth.

cards.name: King of Wands
cards.meaning: Big-picture leadership and decisive action. Turning passion into strategy and results.
cards.meaning_reversed: Vision becomes forceful or self-serving. Overconfidence, impatience, or power plays derail the mission.

cards.name: Ace of Cups
cards.meaning: An opening of the heart. Fresh emotional energy, connection, and the willingness to feel fully.
cards.meaning_reversed: A closed cup—feelings are suppressed or overflowing. Vulnerability is resisted or mishandled.

cards.name: Two of Cups
cards.meaning: A balanced connection. Mutual respect, shared feeling, and a meeting of equals.
cards.meaning_reversed: The bond is uneven or unclear. Needs don’t match, or trust and communication fray.

cards.name: Three of Cups
cards.meaning: Shared joy and emotional support. Friendship, belonging, and celebration with your people.
cards.meaning_reversed: Community turns messy or shallow. Drama, jealousy, or excess disrupts what should be supportive.

cards.name: Four of Cups
cards.meaning: Emotional disengagement or dissatisfaction. A pause to notice what you actually want—and what you’re ignoring.
cards.meaning_reversed: The heart wakes up. Fresh perspective, renewed interest, and willingness to take an offered opportunity.

cards.name: Five of Cups
cards.meaning: Grieving what didn’t work. Honor the loss, while remembering not everything is gone.
cards.meaning_reversed: Recovery begins. You start turning toward what remains and rebuilding from a more honest place.

cards.name: Six of Cups
cards.meaning: Warm memory and simple goodness. Revisiting the past with tenderness; returning to what feels familiar.
cards.meaning_reversed: Nostalgia becomes a trap, or the past is idealized. A call to grow up and meet the present.

cards.name: Seven of Cups
cards.meaning: Many options, not all real. Dreaming big, but needing discernment and grounding.
cards.meaning_reversed: Fog clears. You choose, simplify, and commit—letting go of fantasy to act in reality.

cards.name: Eight of Cups
cards.meaning: Leaving what no longer satisfies. A brave move toward deeper meaning, even if it’s lonely at first.
cards.meaning_reversed: Staying when you should go, or going when you should stay. Avoidance, hesitation, or a return for closure.

cards.name: Nine of Cups
cards.meaning: Enjoying the good stuff. Emotional fulfillment, comfort, and appreciation for what you’ve created.
cards.meaning_reversed: Pleasure without depth. Overdoing it, or realizing a desire fulfilled still doesn’t satisfy.

cards.name: Ten of Cups
cards.meaning: Emotional wholeness and shared happiness. Love that feels stable, supportive, and aligned.
cards.meaning_reversed: The picture-perfect ideal cracks. Needs differ; home or relationship requires honest repair.

cards.name: Page of Cups
cards.meaning: A tender emotional beginning—curiosity, openness, and a small invitation to connect or create.
cards.meaning_reversed: Feelings are reactive or unprocessed. Sensitivity turns defensive; creativity stalls from self-doubt.

cards.name: Knight of Cups
cards.meaning: Following the heart with grace. Romantic or creative pursuit fueled by imagination and sincerity.
cards.meaning_reversed: Sweet words without grounding. Idealism becomes escapism, or charm is used to dodge responsibility.

cards.name: Queen of Cups
cards.meaning: Deep emotional intelligence. Compassionate presence, strong intuition, and steady support.
cards.meaning_reversed: Too porous or too involved. Emotions flood boundaries; care becomes rescuing or self-erasure.

cards.name: King of Cups
cards.meaning: Steady heart and mature compassion. Calm leadership that can hold feelings without being ruled by them.
cards.meaning_reversed: Emotions get buried or weaponized. Detachment, mood swings, or control replaces genuine care.

cards.name: Ace of Swords
cards.meaning: A clean mental breakthrough. Clear truth, decisive thinking, and the courage to name what is real.
cards.meaning_reversed: The blade is dull or misused. Confusion, distorted facts, or rash conclusions cloud judgment.

cards.name: Two of Swords
cards.meaning: A guarded pause before a decision. Weighing options and protecting the heart while seeking mental balance.
cards.meaning_reversed: The stalemate breaks—often messily. Avoidance ends, pressure rises, and the truth pushes through.

cards.name: Three of Swords
cards.meaning: Painful clarity and emotional hurt. A wound that asks to be acknowledged so it can heal cleanly.
cards.meaning_reversed: Recovery after heartbreak. Forgiveness, closure, and moving through grief rather than staying stuck in it.

cards.name: Four of Swords
cards.meaning: Rest and repair for the mind and nervous system. A needed pause before the next push.
cards.meaning_reversed: Rest is resisted or insufficient. Burnout risk rises, or you’re being pushed back into action too soon.

cards.name: Five of Swords
cards.meaning: A fight with a cost. Winning may be hollow; consider what gets damaged when ego leads.
cards.meaning_reversed: Pulling back from pointless conflict. Making amends, owning harm, or choosing peace over pride.

cards.name: Six of Swords
cards.meaning: Leaving turbulence behind. A gradual transition toward calmer waters and clearer thinking.
cards.meaning_reversed: Movement is blocked or the past comes along unprocessed. You’re trying to move on without closure.

cards.name: Seven of Swords
cards.meaning: A strategic or discreet approach. Sometimes cleverness helps; sometimes it signals avoidance or deception.
cards.meaning_reversed: What’s hidden surfaces. Dishonesty backfires, or you choose honesty and responsibility over evasion.

cards.name: Eight of Swords
cards.meaning: Feeling trapped by thoughts and fear. The cage is real emotionally, but the exit often exists.
cards.meaning_reversed: A way out appears. You loosen the bind by changing the story, asking for help, and taking one brave step.

cards.name: Nine of Swords
cards.meaning: Mental anguish and spiraling thoughts. Worry magnifies; compassion and reality checks are needed.
cards.meaning_reversed: The spiral slows. You reach for support, reframe guilt, and reclaim sleep and steadiness.

cards.name: Ten of Swords
cards.meaning: A painful ending and clear finality. Something is done—acknowledge it, then prepare for renewal.
cards.meaning_reversed: The worst is passing. Healing begins, and you start rebuilding from a hard but honest ending.

cards.name: Page of Swords
cards.meaning: A sharp mind and appetite for truth. Learning fast, asking questions, and noticing what others miss.
cards.meaning_reversed: Information is misused or misunderstood. Reactivity, gossip, or fragile ego turns inquiry into conflict.

cards.name: Knight of Swords
cards.meaning: Charging ahead with conviction. Clear, fast action and strong opinions—best when paired with restraint.
cards.meaning_reversed: Too fast, too sharp. Words cut, nuance disappears, and conflict escalates from impatience or certainty.

cards.name: Queen of Swords
cards.meaning: Clear thinking and honest speech. Seeing patterns, setting boundaries, and choosing what’s rational and fair.
cards.meaning_reversed: Truth becomes a weapon. Detachment, cynicism, or unresolved hurt makes the mind sharp but unforgiving.

cards.name: King of Swords
cards.meaning: Mental mastery and principled decision-making. Leading with logic, fairness, and long-term strategy.
cards.meaning_reversed: Rules without humanity. Overcontrol, arrogance, or using intellect to dominate rather than serve truth.

cards.name: Ace of Pentacles
cards.meaning: A tangible new opportunity. A seed for security—money, work, health, or a practical foundation.
cards.meaning_reversed: A practical start is blocked or mishandled. Delays, weak planning, or not valuing the opportunity.

cards.name: Two of Pentacles
cards.meaning: Managing multiple demands with flexibility. Balance through rhythm, not perfection.
cards.meaning_reversed: Too much to juggle. Priorities blur; something needs simplifying, delegating, or choosing.

cards.name: Three of Pentacles
cards.meaning: Building quality through cooperation and skill. Shared standards, mentorship, and real progress.
cards.meaning_reversed: Collaboration breaks down. Conflicting expectations or ego undermines the work and the shared goal.

cards.name: Four of Pentacles
cards.meaning: Protecting resources and maintaining stability. Healthy boundaries around time, money, and energy.
cards.meaning_reversed: Clinging too tightly or losing grip. Fear drives scarcity behavior, or spending/structure becomes sloppy.

cards.name: Five of Pentacles
cards.meaning: Material or emotional strain. Feeling left out, unsupported, or anxious about stability—seek help and reality-check scarcity.
cards.meaning_reversed: A way through appears: support, resources, or renewed hope. Steady steps out of hardship.

cards.name: Six of Pentacles
cards.meaning: Balanced giving and receiving. Support, fairness, and healthy exchange of resources and care.
cards.meaning_reversed: Giving becomes control, or receiving becomes dependence. Unequal exchange needs honest renegotiation.

cards.name: Seven of Pentacles
cards.meaning: Long-term effort and evaluation. Checking progress, refining the plan, and letting results ripen.
cards.meaning_reversed: Effort isn’t matching results. Rethink where you invest time and energy; cut what isn’t growing.

cards.name: Eight of Pentacles
cards.meaning: Improvement through repetition and care. Doing the work, refining technique, and building mastery.
cards.meaning_reversed: Going through the motions or cutting corners. Motivation fades, or standards slip from impatience.

cards.name: Nine of Pentacles
cards.meaning: Enjoying what you’ve built. Confidence, stability, and pleasure earned through consistent effort.
cards.meaning_reversed: Security feels fragile or lonely. Worth is outsourced to status, or independence becomes isolation.

cards.name: Ten of Pentacles
cards.meaning: Lasting foundations—family, wealth, community, and traditions that endure. Building beyond the self.
cards.meaning_reversed: Foundations wobble: family tension, financial strain, or values misaligned. Long-term planning is missing.

cards.name: Page of Pentacles
cards.meaning: A practical beginning—study, training, or a small opportunity that can grow with effort.
cards.meaning_reversed: The start is delayed by distraction or poor planning. A reminder to ground the goal in real steps.

cards.name: Knight of Pentacles
cards.meaning: Slow, steady progress. Showing up, doing the work, and building real results over time.
cards.meaning_reversed: Routine becomes a rut. Resistance to change, lack of momentum, or overwork without purpose.

cards.name: Queen of Pentacles
cards.meaning: Grounded care and practical abundance. Creating stability through smart choices and steady support.
cards.meaning_reversed: Care drains you or turns controlling. Stress around money/home, or neglecting your own needs.

cards.name: King of Pentacles
cards.meaning: Material mastery and wise stewardship. Building sustainable success and providing through reliability and ethics.
cards.meaning_reversed: Success becomes possessive or ethically thin. Fear of loss, vanity, or control undermines true stability.
